results.title: His Girl Friday
results.brief_description: Cary Grant is the cheeky news editor, Rosalind Russell is the ace female reporter with printer’s ink in her veins. Amid the frenzy of newsmen competing for that front page story, high energy romance, and Ben Hecht’s famous overlapping dialogue and machine-gun paced script, a reporter about to get married and escape the newsworld, stumbles upon the biggest story of her career - a notorious criminal surrenders personally. One of the funniest and most biting screwball comedies on film. Also stars Ralph Bellamy. Based on the 1928 play “The Front page” by Ben Hecht and Charles MacArthur and a remake of the 1931 Howard Hughes film “The Front page”.

results.title: Hiroshima mon amour
results.creator_credit: Alain Resnais, Samy Halfron, Shirakawa Takeo, Sacha Kamenka, Daiei Motion Picture Company, Pathe Overseas, Como Films and Argos Films
results.brief_description: A French actress, in Hiroshima to take part in a film about peace, has a brief affair with a Japanese man. As they discuss the horror and consequences of the nuclear destruction of the city, the woman slowly, hesitantly begins to reveal the story of her own individual horror when she was punished for loving a German soldier during World war II. Combining footage of the destruction of Hiroshima, the film eschews linear narrative and instead moves back and forth between the past and present, exploring the effects of memory and trauma. Scripted by novelist Marguerite Duras, “Hiroshima Mon Amour” heralded a new phase for international cinema, a precursor to the New Wave, and the development of a cinema that would explore contemporary questions of philosophy and politics. Though the “stories” which the film explores are powerfully involving, the formal structure of the film forces the viewer to confront his or her own personal construction of “memory” as mediated through film and history. The film shows the impossibility of “explaining” Hiroshima but also convincingly explores the need to permanently interrogate the conditions which led to Hiroshima.

results.title: High society (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sol Siegel, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation and Charles Walters
results.brief_description: Bing Crosby, Grace Kelly and Frank Sinatra romp elegantly through the scenic, moneyed grounds and waters of outwardly elitist Newport, Rhode Island in this hip, witty, musical version of Philip Barry’s ‘The Philadelphia story’. Legendary Louis Armstrong, starring as himself, plays his trumpet and narrates in prose and song the peccadillos of his song-writer friend C. K. Dexter-Haven as he tries to win back his haughty ex-wife on the eve of her marriage. Music by Cole Porter.

results.title: High Sierra
results.creator_credit: Raoul Walsh, Hal B. Wallis, First National Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Newly released from prison, bank robber “Mad Dog” Roy Earle (Humphrey Bogart) agrees to one last caper, out of gratitude to an old gangland pal. However, Earle has changed after eight years in gaol. He is torn between his hard-boiled, brutal side and more caring, compassionate feelings, which ultimately cause his downfall. When getaway plans misfire, Earle flees to the High Sierras. In a defiant last stand he is trapped at 11,000 feet with an army of police waiting below.

results.title: Henry Ford's America
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Paul Wright, Donald Brittain, Roman Kroitor and Janet Leissner
results.brief_description: An inside look at the workings of the Ford Motor Company. Traces the history of the company using historical footage, and interviews with Henry Ford II and other company executives. Looks at the developing role of the car within American society. Script, Donald Brittain. Editing, Rosemarie Shapely and Les Halman. Images, Andreas Poulsson. Music, Art Phillips.

results.title: Hello London
results.creator_credit: George Fowler, Kinran and Sidney Smith
results.brief_description: Musical film starring Olympic gold medalist and world famous ice-skater, Sonja Henie, and co-starring Michael Wilding with Stanley Holloway. Light-hearted song and dance film on ice set in London. The cast, including Sonja, all play under their own names.

results.title: Hell in the Pacific
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Reuben Bercovitch and Selmur Pictures
results.brief_description: Set during the second World War, this film concerns an American marine pilot (Marvin), who is stalked by a Japanese navy officer (Mifune), while stranded on a remote Pacific island. The American is captured but manages to escape and turn into the captor of the Japanese navy officer. After a while they realise they need not be adversaries and begin an uneasy friendship and dependency on each other for survival.

results.title: Heatwave
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Ross Matthews, Hilary Linstead and Heatwave Films Pty Ltd, Sydney Australia F F P A A
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller about a woman who cared too much about people, their lives and their homes, and a man who had a job to do and wouldn’t be swayed by emotions. She represented the people, he represented power and corruption and together they were heading towards trouble. Cast includes Judy Davis, Richard Moir, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter and John Meillon. PLEASE NOTE: THE 16MM PRINT OF THIS FILM HAS NORWEGIAN SUBTITLES

results.title: Heathers
results.creator_credit: Michael Lehmann, Denise Di Novi, Cinemarque Entertainment and New World Pictures
results.brief_description: This black comedy about high school politics, teenage suicide and trendy cliques, focuses on the ‘Heathers’, three of the prettiest and most popular rich girls at Westerbury High School, home of preppies, nerds and trendies. They set the trends, make the rules and devise ways of making life hell for the other students. That is until Heather No.4 who is really a Veronica, (Winona Ryder), teams up with her boyfriend, JD, a rebellious new student (Christian Slater), to change all the rules and seek revenge. An ultimate revenge fantasy which has become a “cult” movie. Also stars Shannen Doherty.

results.title: Harvie Krumpet
results.creator_credit: Adam Elliot, Melanie Coombs, SBS Independent, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission and Melodrama Pictures
results.brief_description:
Adam Elliot’s bittersweet claymation short work opens in Poland in 1922 with the birth of Harvek Milos Krumpetzki - an innocent child beguiled with the world, born to doting and quite dotty parents.

Despite being mercilessly teased as a child, Harvek maintains interest in his surrounds, encouraged by his mother who assists him in collecting wonderful ‘fakts’ about the world. One night Harvek’s life is irrevocably altered when WWII breaks out and he migrates to a faraway land - Australia. In an attempt to assimilate Harvek changes his name to Harvie Krumpet and, in the suburb of Spotswood, begins a new life involving marriage, parenthood and finally, old age.

Winner of the 2003 Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film, and narrated by Geoffrey Rush.
